Comment: Some companies just turn down the power or water usage without trying to make them as good as before.  When low-flush toilets were first introduced a lot of companies just added blocks to the inside of the tank to drop the amount of water per flush, but didn't re-design the bowl to better use the lower amount of water, resulting in people complaining that low flow toilets were bad at flushing. Which some definitely were.  When I upgraded my toilets I saw some videos of the company flushing various things (marbles, hot dogs, giant wads of toilet paper, etc) to prove how good their flushing power was. Haven't had an issue except when the kids try to flush paper towel.
